title: ðŸ’¾ C++ (Intermediate Level)
description: Test your understanding of OOP, templates, and STL concepts

questions.question: Which of the following correctly defines a constructor in C++?
What is function overloading in C++?
options: Using same function name with different parameters
Using different function names with same parameters
questions.answer: Using same function name with different parameters

questions.question: Which of the following is not true about destructors?
options: They have the same name as the class prefixed with ~

questions.question: Which keyword is used to prevent a class from being inherited?
Which of the following can access private members of a class?
What is the size of an empty class in C++?
Which concept allows the same function to behave differently based on objects?
What is the difference between struct and class in C++?
options: Struct members are private by default
Class members are private by default
questions.answer: Class members are private by default

questions.question: Which of the following is used to define pure virtual functions?
How is dynamic polymorphism implemented in C++?
Which class is at the top of C++ exception hierarchy?
Which STL container stores key-value pairs?
What does 'this' pointer point to?
Which operator cannot be overloaded?
What is the difference between shallow copy and deep copy?
options: Shallow copies pointers only, deep copies actual data
questions.answer: Shallow copies pointers only, deep copies actual data

questions.question: Which keyword is used to handle exceptions?
Which smart pointer calls delete automatically when object goes out of scope?
Which of the following is true for inline functions?
What is the output of sizeof('A')?
How can you prevent overriding of a virtual function?
Which feature allows defining multiple functions with same name but different arguments?
Which type of inheritance can lead to diamond problem?
Which operator is overloaded when we use cout << x?
Which of these keywords is used to inherit a class?
What happens if a base class destructor is not virtual?
options: Derived class destructor won't be called
questions.answer: Derived class destructor won't be called

questions.question: Which STL container allows insertion and deletion at both ends?
Which of the following cannot be a friend?
Which of these is true about static member functions?
options: They can access only static members
They cannot be defined outside class
questions.answer: They can access only static members

questions.question: What is the default access specifier for class members?
Which STL container maintains elements in sorted order by key?
What is the purpose of 'mutable' keyword in C++?
options: Allows modification of member even in const object
questions.answer: Allows modification of member even in const object

questions.question: Which constructor is called when object is copied?
What is the purpose of the 'explicit' keyword?
Which container uses Last In First Out principle?
Which of these correctly defines a template function?
Which operator is automatically called when an object goes out of scope?
Which STL container provides random access?
What does 'override' keyword ensure?
options: Base and derived function signatures match
questions.answer: Base and derived function signatures match

questions.question: Which of the following iterators can move backward?
Which is used to allocate memory dynamically in C++?
What does RAII stand for in C++?
Which keyword is used to inherit constructors of base class?
Which operator is used to free dynamically allocated memory?
Which STL algorithm sorts a vector?
Which of the following allows dynamic binding in C++?
Which function is used to terminate a C++ program immediately?
What is the output type of 'map.find()'?
Which feature of OOP provides data hiding?
Which keyword is used to rethrow the current exception?
Which function is used to release memory allocated by new?
Which of the following cannot be declared as static?
Which of these STL containers does not allow duplicates?
Which of the following is true for references?
Which of the following correctly declares a namespace?
